sources.note: Main vendor website. Heavily JS-rendered (Divi/WordPress), most content not extractable. Title confirms 'iCare | The Enterprise Cloud EHR'.
Product marketing page titled 'Proven Cloud-Based EHR'. Content not extractable due to JS rendering.
Ambulatory care EHR product page. Content not extractable due to JS rendering, but search snippets describe full-featured ambulatory EHR.
Acute care EHR product page. Content not extractable, but search snippets describe hospital/inpatient EHR with integrated suite.
E-prescribing product page. Content not extractable, but search snippets describe EPCS, drug interaction checks, real-time tracking.
Revenue Cycle Management product page. Content not extractable, but search snippets describe billing, coding, claims, and payment automation.
Subscription tiers/editions page. Content not extractable due to JS rendering.
EHI export documentation page (Phase 2 target). Content not extractable due to JS rendering.

FindEMR listing. 0 reviews. Describes cloud-based EHR for ambulatory and acute care. Lists features: scheduling, clinical documentation, e-prescribing, patient portal, RCM, document management. Pricing tiers from Free to $175/month.
SoftwareFinder listing. 3 reviews, 5-star aggregate. Describes single-tenant SaaS, ambulatory and acute care. Lists integrations with Change Healthcare and CareDox. Contact: (661) 384-7070.
Capterra listing. 403 access denied during fetch. Search snippets confirm iCare EHR listing exists.
Software Advice listing. 403 access denied during fetch. Search snippets indicate product profile exists.
Slashdot/SourceForge listing. No user reviews. Describes fully integrated EHR with admin, clinical, and RCM capabilities. Founded 2012. Free version available.
SourceForge product listing. No reviews (0.0/5). Lists features: scheduling, e-prescribing, patient portal, billing, HIPAA compliance, mobile apps, speech recognition. Founded 2012.

Open Health News article about HIMSS15 debut. iCare claimed to be 'first new enterprise EHR in 16 years'. Cloud-native, open API, iOS app in Swift, per-user monthly pricing. Received Complete Inpatient MU Stage 2 Certification Jan 2015.
South Florida Hospital News article. Redirect error prevented content extraction. Title confirms coverage of iCare as 'advanced EHR delivered in the cloud'.
Crunchbase profile. Founded 2011 by Jim Riley, Ted Schneider, Don Cook. Fort Lauderdale. No funding raised.
Tracxn profile. Confirms founding 2011, Fort Lauderdale. Enterprise cloud EHR for healthcare facilities of all sizes.
LinkedIn company page. Lists 51-200 employees (11 profiles). Describes enterprise cloud EHR solutions. Claims to be one of fastest growing EHR providers.
ContactOut company profile. Confirms iCare.com company details and staff directory.
